subject: Politics
title: The IMF and World Bank
description: A quick, practical guide to The IMF and World Bank.

hook.text: The IMF lends money to struggling nations â€” then demands budget cuts that hurt the poorest people first.

buildup.text: The IMF and World Bank were created in 1944 to stabilize the global economy and fund development.

discovery.text: IMF loans come with conditions: cut spending, privatize industries, and open markets. It's called structural adjustment.

twist.text: Structural adjustment devastated Africa and Latin America in the 1980s. Poverty rose while debts grew.

climax.text: Both institutions are dominated by Western votes. The US effectively holds veto power at the IMF.

punchline.text: The IMF rescues economies. Critics say the medicine is worse than the disease.

quiz.question: What is 'structural adjustment'?
options: IMF conditions requiring spending cuts, privatization, and market opening
A program that increases government spending in developing nations
An interest-free loan program for the poorest countries
